meanings.definition: The act of being cowardly or lacking courage.
meanings.sent1: His cowage was evident when he refused to stand up for his beliefs.
meanings.sent2: Her cowage prevented her from speaking up in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent3: Despite his cowage, he managed to muster the courage to face his fears.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of cowage followed him wherever he went, holding him back.
meanings.sent5: The image of his trembling hands became a symbol of his cowage.

meanings.definition: A feeling of fear or apprehension.
meanings.sent1: The dark alley filled her with cowage as she hurried past.
meanings.sent2: His heart raced with cowage as he approached the haunted house.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't help but laugh at her own cowage when faced with a tiny spider.
meanings.sent4: The looming deadline cast a shadow of cowage over the team.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind outside added to the sense of cowage in the old house.

meanings.definition: To behave in a timid or fearful manner.
meanings.sent1: He would cowage in the face of danger, always seeking safety.
meanings.sent2: She tends to cowage when confronted with new challenges.
meanings.sent3: The cat would cowage at the sight of a cucumber placed behind it.
meanings.sent4: The soldier refused to cowage, standing tall in the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: Her voice would cowage whenever she had to speak in public.
